questions.text: What is the fundamental problem that the study of economics addresses?
Scarcity exists because:
options: People’s wants are limited, but resources are unlimited.
#Resources are limited, but people’s wants are unlimited.
Both wants and resources are unlimited.
Resources and wants are both limited to the same level.

questions.text: Which of the following best illustrates the concept of scarcity?
options: #A student choosing between spending time on studying or relaxing.
A store offering a 50% discount on clothes.
A company producing more goods due to new technology.
A farmer harvesting crops during the summer.

questions.text: Which of the following best describes the concept of efficiency?
options: #Using resources in a way that gets the most output from them.
Producing more goods even if some resources are wasted.
Keeping resources unused for future generations.
Focusing only on providing employment for people.

questions.text: Which of the following best describes the concept of equality in economics?
options: #Sharing wealth fairly among all members of society.
Using resources in the most productive way.
Producing goods people want the most.
Allowing markets to work without any control.

questions.text: Which of the following best describes rational people in economics?
options: #People who make choices to achieve their goals.
People who decide things without thinking.
People who always follow other people’s opinions.
People who act randomly in daily decisions.

questions.text: Which of the following best describes an incentive in economics?
options: #Something that motivates a person to take action.
Something that prevents people from making choices.
Something that limits how people can use resources.
Something that makes all decisions automatic.

questions.text: A marginal change is one that:
options: Is not important for public policy.

questions.text: Because people respond to incentives:
options: Policymakers can alter outcomes by changing punishments or rewards.
Society faces a trade-off between efficiency and equality.

questions.text: According to the principle of opportunity cost, what is the cost of an economic decision?
options: #The value of the next best alternative foregone

questions.text: Which principle suggests that people make decisions by comparing marginal benefits and marginal costs?
International trade benefits a nation when:
options: Its revenue from selling abroad exceeds its outlays from buying abroad.
Its trading partners experience reduced economic well-being.
#All nations specialize in doing what they do best.
No domestic jobs are lost because of trade.

questions.text: Adam Smith’s “invisible hand” refers to:
options: Hidden methods that businesses use to profit at consumers’ expense.
#The ability of competitive markets to reach desirable outcomes, despite the self-interest of market participants.
The way producers or consumers impose costs on bystanders.

questions.text: Governments may intervene in a market economy in order to:
options: Correct market failures due to externalities.
Achieve a more equal distribution of income.

questions.text: Which of the following is a positive, rather than a normative, statement?
options: Law X is a good piece of legislation.
Congress ought to pass law X.
The president should veto law X.

questions.text: The following parts of government regularly rely on the advice of economists:
Economists may disagree because they have different:
In an hour, Mateo can wash 2 cars or mow 1 lawn, and Sophia can wash 3 cars or mow 1 lawn. Who has the absolute advantage?
options: Mateo in washing, Sophia in mowing
Sophia in washing, Mateo in mowing
Mateo in washing, neither in mowing

questions.text: In an hour, Mateo can wash 2 cars or mow 1 lawn, and Sophia can wash 3 cars or mow 1 lawn. Who has the comparative advantage?
options: Mateo in washing, Sophia in mowing
Mateo in washing, neither in mowing
Sophia in washing, neither in mowing

questions.text: A nation will typically import those goods in which:
options: The nation has an absolute advantage.
The nation has a comparative advantage.
Other nations have an absolute advantage.

questions.text: Suppose producing an aircraft takes 10,000 hours in the U.S. and 40,000 in China; a shirt takes 2 hours in the U.S. and 4 in China. What will these nations trade?
options: China exports aircraft, U.S. exports shirts.

questions.text: Kayla can cook dinner in 30 min and wash laundry in 20. Her roommate takes twice as long. How should they allocate work?
options: #No gains from trade in this situation.

questions.text: When Mateo and Sophia produce efficiently and trade based on comparative advantage:
options: Mateo washes more, Sophia mows more.
Mateo and Sophia both wash more.
Mateo and Sophia both mow more.

questions.text: Most economists believe that tariffs are:
options: A good way to promote domestic growth.
#A poor way to raise general economic well-being.
A necessary response to foreign competition.
An efficient way to raise revenue.

questions.text: The best definition of a market is:
options: A store offering goods and services.
A place where an auctioneer calls out prices.
#A group of buyers and sellers of a good or service.
A venue with a single supplier.

questions.text: In a perfectly competitive market:
options: Sellers distinguish themselves by product differences.
#Each seller takes the market price as given.

questions.text: The market for which product best fits perfect competition?
What is the primary characteristic of a market economy?
An economic model is:
options: A fully detailed description of the economy
#A simplified representation of some aspect of the economy
A computer prediction of the future

questions.text: In the circular-flow diagram, in factor markets:
options: Households are buyers, firms are sellers.

An increase in the price of root beer (a complement)

options: #Economic profit includes explicit & implicit costs; accounting only explicit.
Economic profit includes only explicit costs.
Economic profit includes only implicit costs.

questions.text: If a firm's marginal product of labor is 10, it means:
options: #Each extra labor adds 10 units of output.

questions.text: Diminishing marginal product of labor means:
options: #Change in output decreases as more labor is added.
Change in output increases with more labor.
